channel.title: Senior Year; USMC Bound
channel.description:
As summers yearns closer and closer, i begin to think about my future and my family. These past few months i have decided to join the USMC (United States Marines Corps) because they are the most respected and most feared force in the US military naval.
Now im sure you know of someone that has joined the marines; or any naval force in fact. I would just like to know what my future looks like joining the marines and what i should i do in the marines? what job? what contract? I have a specific eye on the marines reserves and studying to become a marine officer.
Positive feedback will be appreciated . Thank you moparisthebest community!

item.title: Senior Year; USMC Bound
item.dc:creator: @mona_lisa mona lisa
item.description:
@mona_lisa wrote:

First of all if you plan on making a career out of the military doing the full 20 years for retirement then the marines would be your last choice. If you do want to be an officer then yes i suggest goin into the reserves or some type of national guard so you can earn your degree while serving your time. If you go active it will be much harder to obtain your degree.Whatever your choice is i wish you the best of luck, there is nothing like the brotherhood that you experience in the military.

Read full topic

mk dats y we lend aircrft 2 britain probs cauz u gys wrekin all urs[/quote]

I say this because they blew up a Canadian platoon that was on exercise and an (Australian)? platoon.

item.title: Senior Year; USMC Bound
item.dc:creator: @nsfpure nsfpure
item.description:
@nsfpure wrote:

[quote=“Marine5287, post:11, topic:396533”][quote author=jme link=topic=493707.msg3609850#msg3609850 date=1306460688]

If I went into the military it would have to be the AirForce, At least 1 person from every generation has been in.

I’d want to be a sniper, if it wasn’t so difficult to get into. 24 hour missions sound fun to me, in a group of 2-3 people. You have more independence and decision making.

Canadian snipers are incredible. I’d need too many lifestyle changes to dream of becoming one though.
[/quote]

What makes Canadian snipers better than others? Not trying to start a fight I’m just wondering.[/quote]

Quick input on this. Don’t care how long ago this was, if you want a good team of marksmen look at the IRA (Irish Republican Army, not the real army but still) sniper division, signs had to be put up in Northern Ireland to warn people of these snipers because they would NOT miss

Read full topic

Canadian snipers are incredible. I’d need too many lifestyle changes to dream of becoming one though.
[/quote]

What makes Canadian snipers better than others? Not trying to start a fight I’m just wondering.[/quote]

Their government gives them a bigger commission and bigger dependence.

item.title: Senior Year; USMC Bound
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Without a college education, your going to be on the front line.
You can’t get that far with out an degree. Your recruiter will probably BS you saying you will get the job you want, but chances are you will not.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Marine5287 wrote:

I might be joining soon also. Depends if my hockey career takes me somewhere. If I do go I’m joining the infantry, it gets the most action But becoming an officer is a better career choice in the Marines. Good luck!

item.title: Senior Year; USMC Bound
item.dc:creator: @Dell Dell
item.description:
@Dell wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:2, topic:396533”]Don’t join to be respected by others. Join for yourself.

My Father and Brother were both Marines, don’t know much details so I cant really help you there.

It is a well rounded choice for the future, though.[/quote]

Yeah, im joining to turn myself into a more mature person and help me expose myself into new challenges.
And thanks good to hear from you again old friend.

Read full topic
